Checker

Class CheckerDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Checker.CheckerDriver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class CheckerDriver
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    driver class, responsible for representing the board and running the game
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setBoard

        public void setBoard(int[][] b)
        set the board based on a given array
        Parameters:
        b - is an 8x8 int array

      • pieceDecode

        public static Checker.Piece pieceDecode(int code)
        decode, to get the correct Piece value
        Parameters:
        code - is the given code
        Returns:
        the Piece value according to the code: 1: Piece.BLACK 2: Piece.RED 3: Piece.KING_B 4: Piece.KING_R other: Piece.NONE

      • legalMoves

        public java.util.LinkedList<Checker.IntPair> legalMoves(int row,
                                                        int col,
                                                        boolean justJump)
        check the given piece, then return a list of squares that it can moves to. Note that if a jump is possible, it is the only legal move. If multiple jumps are possible, only those jumps are legal moves.
        Parameters:
        row - is the row of the piece
        col - is the collumn of the piece
        justJump - shows if the piece just completed a jump. If true, the piece just jump, and only jumps are counted as next legal moves
        Returns:
        the list of legal moves.

      • movePiece

        public boolean movePiece(int row,
                         int col,
                         Checker.IntPair newLocation)
        actually move the piece by modifying the board, note that the move should be checked for legality first
        Parameters:
        row - is the row of the piece
        col - is the column of the piece
        newLocation - is an IntPair object specify the new location
        Returns:
        true if it is a jump, and the user can make another move with that piece false if the move ends the turn

      • movePiece

        public boolean movePiece(int currRow,
                         int currCol,
                         int newRow,
                         int newCol)
        actually move the piece by modifying the board, note that the move should be checked for legality first, before calling this function
        Parameters:
        currRow - is the current row of the piece
        currCol - is the current column of the piece
        newRow - is the new row to move to
        newCol - is the new column to move to
        Returns:
        true if it is a jump, and the user can make another jump with that piece false if the move ends the turn

      • kingPiece

        public void kingPiece()
        king all the pieces that we need to king. The function will scan and modify the board accordingly This function should be called after a piece is moved.

      • isLost

        public boolean isLost(int player)
        check if a side lose (he/she cannot make any other move). This function should be called at the start of the turn, to determine if the current player cannot move and lose
        Parameters:
        player - is the side to check. 1 means Black, 2 means Red
        Returns:
        true if the checked player cannot make any other move false if the checked player can make another move

      • getBoard

        public int[][] getBoard()
        get the board
        Returns:
        an 8x8 int array representing the board

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        print board to System.out
